questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many protons does carbon have?
questionList.solution: The atomic number (6) is equal to the number of protons in Carbon.

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many protons does sulfur have?
questionList.solution: The atomic number (16) is equal to the number of protons in Sulfur.

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many protons does potassium have?
questionList.solution: The atomic number (19) is equal to the number of protons in Potassium.

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many protons does helium have?
questionList.solution: The atomic number (2) is equal to the number of protons in Helium.

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many protons does lithium have?
questionList.solution: The atomic number (3) is equal to the number of protons in Lithium.

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many protons does beryllium have?
questionList.solution: The atomic number (4) is equal to the number of protons in Beryllium.

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many protons does nitrogen have?
questionList.solution: The atomic number (7) is equal to the number of protons in Nitrogen.

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many protons does oxygen have?
questionList.solution: The atomic number (8) is equal to the number of protons in Oxygen.

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many protons does flourine have?
questionList.solution: The atomic number (9) is equal to the number of protons in Flourine.

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many protons does sodium have?
questionList.solution: The atomic number (11) is equal to the number of protons in Sodium.

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many neutrons does carbon have?
questionList.solution: The mass number minus the atomic number (12-6) is equal to the number of neutrons in Carbon (6).

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many neutrons does sulfur have?
questionList.solution: The mass number minus the atomic number (32-16) is equal to the number of neutrons in Sulfur (16).

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many neutrons does potassium have?
questionList.solution: The mass number minus the atomic number (39-19) is equal to the number of neutrons in Potassium (20).

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many neutrons does helium have?
questionList.solution: The mass number minus the atomic number (4-2) is equal to the number of neutrons in Helium (2).

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many neutrons does lithium have?
questionList.solution: The mass number minus the atomic number (7-3) is equal to the number of neutrons in Lithium (4).

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many neutrons does beryllium have?
questionList.solution: The mass number minus the atomic number (9-4) is equal to the number of neutrons in Beryllium (5).

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many neutrons does nitrogen have?
questionList.solution: The mass number minus the atomic number (14-7) is equal to the number of neutrons in Nitrogen (7).

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many neutrons does oxygen have?
questionList.solution: The mass number minus the atomic number (16-8) is equal to the number of neutrons in Oxygen (8).

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many neutrons does flourine have?
questionList.solution: The mass number minus the atomic number (18-9) is equal to the number of neutrons in Flourine (9).

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many neutrons does sodium have?
questionList.solution: The mass number minus the atomic number (23-11) is equal to the number of neutrons in Sodium (12).
